subject: South Korea May 1st-20th trade balance at surplus of USD 1.55bln, exports rose 14.8% and imports rose 10.7%, according to customs

PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIA, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: AGL (AGL AT) rejects Alinta offer for Liddell power station, Japan Tobacco (2914 JT) cigarette sales fell over 13% Y/Y for April; LG Group Chairman passed away
content:
AUSTRALIA

AGL Energy (AGL AT)
- Co. rejected Alinta offer for the Liddell power station in which it stated it will not proceed with offer and will close the power station in December 2022 as planned. (Newswires)

Aurizon Holdings (AZJ AT)
- BHP (BHP AT) coal unit is planning to review claw-back options in at least 2 large haulage contracts amid Queensland Competition Authority pricing-related dispute. (AFR)

Metcash (MTS AT)
- iRexchange targets shaking up the wholesale grocery market and Metcash’s dominance with the start up confident it can achieve AUD 4bln in sales. (AFR)

oOh! Media (OOH AT)
- Co. made revised offer for to acquire Adshel after its initial was said to have failed. (The Australian)

Santos (STO AT)
- Harbour Energy reportedly raised its bid for the Co.to AUD 14.2bln, while Co. advises shareholders to take no action. (Newswires)

Vocus Communications (VOC AT)
- Co. confirms Kevin Russell as its MD & CEO. (Newswires)

Westpac (WBC AT)
- The Royal Commission will be examining the Co. related to business lending including in some instances where guarantors lost their homes. (AFR)

Basic Materials / Energy
- Dalian iron ore declined 3.9% on Friday.
- WTI crude futures fell 0.2% on Friday’s session, but are up 0.4% since the reopen of electronic trade.


JAPAN

FujiFilm Holdings (4901 JT)
- Co. FY17/18 net JPY 140.7bln vs. Prev. JPY 131.5bln Y/Y, oper. profit JPY 130.7bln vs. Exp. JPY 139.4bln. (Newswires
- Co. guides FY18/19 oper. profit JPY 200bln vs. Exp. JPY 209bln.

Inpex (1605 JT)
- Co. names Takayuki Ueda as next CEO. (Nikkei)

Japan Tobacco (2914 JT)
- Co. domestic cigarette sales volumes fell 13.2% Y/Y to 6.7bln units in April. (Newswires)

MS&AD Insurance (8725 JT)
- Co. FY17/18 net JPY 154.1bln vs. Exp. JPY 143.5bln, ordinary profit JPY 211.5bln vs. Prev. JPY 352,6bln Y/Y, to repurchase JPY 30bln of share or as much as 1.69% of total outstanding. (Newswires)

NEC Corp. (6701 JT)
- ITC is said to probe certain submarine telecom systems and components after NEC submitted a complaint. (Newswires)

Nikon Corp (7731 JT)
- Co. to dissolve manufacturing subsidiary in China. (Newswires)

Sumitomo Corp (8053 JT)
- Co. reportedly to acquire Indian steel JV for about USD 200mln. (Newswires)

Financials
- Japan FSA asked regional lenders in Japan to limit unrealized losses on securities investments to the amount of profits of core lending businesses. (Newswires)

SOUTH KOREA
 

GC Pharma (006280 KS)
- Co. is to set up unit focus on new vaccines development. (Newswires)

Korea Gas (036460 KS)
- Co. is aiming to take lead in LNG bunkering by designating it a new strategic business. (Newswires)

LG Electronics (066570 KS)
- Co.’s ThinQ sales are topping the Co.’s prior flagship smartphone models. (Yonhap)

LG Group
- LG Group Chairman Koo Bon-moo died on Sunday following a battle with brain disease. (Newswires)

Other News
- South Korea LG economic Research Institute think tank says that a sizeable number of domestic firms are hard-pressed on covering outstanding debt repayments from profits, which could expose them to further risks amid steady increase in rates. (Newswires)

subject: Fonterra expected to issue forecasts for opening 2018/19 farmgate milk prices this Thursday
New Zealand Retail Sales (Q1) Q/Q 0.1% vs. Exp. 1.0% (Prev. 1.7%)
London Metal Exchange is planning CNY-denominated futures contracts, according to Hong Kong press

Broad heightened-risk appetite seen at the open of electronic trade with S&P 500 up 0.7% and mini DJIA futures gaining over 200 points following weekend news that previously announced tariffs on China were put on hold as talks US-China talks proceed
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights Include New Zealand Retail Sales, Japanese Trade Balance, Imports & exports, Thailand GDP
Iran pledges to adhere to the nuclear agreement if EU helps it offset US sanctions

US Trade Representative Lighthizer stated that US may still resort to tariffs and other measures such as restrictions on investment and export regulations unless China makes real structural adjustments to its economy
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
TRADE

US Treasury Secretary Mnuchin stated that previously announced tariffs on Chinese steel and aluminium, as well as USD 150bln of tariffs on other Chinese imports, would be placed on hold as discussions with China proceed. (Newswires)

China agreed to buy more US goods as an effort to avert a trade war, although it refused to commit to US demand to reduce the trade surplus by USD 200bln and did not place a figure for narrowing the trade gap. (Newswires)

US will send a delegation to China for talks regarding agricultural and energy exports, according to a joint statement following the conclusion of the trade talks in Washington. (China Daily)

NEC Director Kudlow said on Friday that US-China talks are going very well but if China talks do not succeed, Trump is prepared to take tough action on his own, while he also commented on Friday that China offered to reduce the trade deficit with US by more than USD 200bln and defined it as a 'good number'. (Newswires)

EU and India filed a list of US imports on Friday which may be subject to additional tariffs in retaliation to US steel and aluminium tariffs. (Newswires)

Russian Economy Minister said the US refused to discuss tariffs with Russia within WTO framework and that Russia is considering a response. (Newswires)
 

ASIA-PAC

South Korean PPI (Apr) M/M 0.1% (Prev. 0.0%). (Newswires)
South Korean PPI (Apr) Y/Y 1.6% (Prev. 1.3%)


UK

Some UK Conservative MPs are said to preparing for the possibility of a snap election in autumn amid Brexit stalemate. (Times/ The Sun)


EU

Italy’s League leader Salvini stated that he agreed with 5-Star Movement Leader Di Maio on choice of Premier and the cabinet for a coalition government, in which neither of the party leaders will become Prime Minister while they will reveal their choice to Italian President Mattarella who is expected to summon them this Monday. (abc NEWS)

S&P affirmed Switzerland at 'AAA/A-1+'; Outlook Stable and affirmed Netherlands at 'AAA/A-1+'; Outlook Stable. (Newswires)


COMMODITIES

US Baker Hughes Total Rig Count (11 May) 1046 (Prev. 1045). (Newswires)
 

US

Trump legal advisor Giuliani said Special Counsel Mueller will conclude Trump obstruction probe by September 1st. (Russia Today)


MARKET RECAP

US equity futures sold off at the cash-open and traded mostly rangebound for the rest of the session, with wires keen to attribute the losses to uncertainty around US-China negotiations. On the week, ES posts modest losses, and is closing-out just shy of the key 2720 level. In stocks specifics, Applied Materials (AMAT), Nordstrom (JWN) and Campbell Soup (CPB) were at the bottom of the S&P after reporting their earnings whilst Deere (DE) led the index for the session after reporting encouraging numbers and raising its 2018 revenue guidance. In M&A news, PayPal (PYPL) outperformed in the NASDAQ amid its acquisition of iZettle for USD 2.2bln to expand its operations in Europe/Latin America. Separately, Dell has begun talking with holders of its Vmware (VMW) tracking stock to measure interest in a merger with Vmware (VMW). SPX -0.26%, NDX -0.51%, DJI +0.01%.

Treasuries climbed higher on Friday and found buyers after a relatively bearish week for the complex. On the week, the 10yr yields posted its biggest rise in a month. The yield curve saw some modest flattening on Friday, with 2yr yields lower by c.2bps, 10yr and 30yr yields by c.4bps. 2s5s and 2s10s narrowed by c.3bps in the session. US 10yr T-Notes futures settled 10+ ticks higher at 118-27.
